relevant_keywords: edge deployable deep neural network model

explanations.machine learning: The paper discusses the use of machine learning in developing a model for gesture recognition in American Sign Language (ASL).
explanations.classification: The developed model is capable of classifying input ASL gestures in real-time with an accuracy of 89.4%.
explanations.neural network: The paper mentions the use of a deep neural network model for gesture recognition.
explanations.deep learning: The proposed device utilizes deep learning techniques for interpreting and recognizing ASL gestures.
explanations.representation learning: The model likely involves learning representations of ASL gestures from radar data.
explanations.deep neural network: The paper explicitly mentions the development of an edge deployable deep neural network model for gesture recognition.
explanations.edge deployable deep neural network mode: The paper proposes a deep neural network model that is deployable on edge devices for real-time ASL gesture classification.
